channel.title: How do i make ?action=1, 2, 3, 4 etc?
channel.description:
how do i make ?action=1, 2, 3, 4 etc?
Need a tut for that please.
Searched google, but none TUTORIALS about it.

@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:12, topic:265777”]The way I look at these is $_POST could be referred to as… “Hey scooby Doo, did you put your Post(username) in the form and your password ‘Post(password)’?”

As for $_GET, i think of it as… “Hey dolly, we need to get the Get(page) for our site, make sure you get the homepage(Get(page=all))”… Yeah, kind of wierd but self explainatory.[/quote]

you are the whitest nigger ever

item.title: How do i make ?action=1, 2, 3, 4 etc?
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:5, topic:265777”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=350883.msg2700304#msg2700304 date=1236550138]

Also if your using a database it would useful with links like:

if($_GET[id] == $row['id']){
// ...some content
}

That way you dont have to add content on your home page all the time when you can just type from whatever you use to insert information into it.

What?
[/quote]
I think he’s pretending to know what he’s talking about.[/quote]

LOL Imean:
[php]
if($_GET[‘page’] == “home”){
homepage() // a function but you can put more content beside that…
}
[/php]

ok, so like when person is on the page you can put [php]?page=home[/php] at the end.

like for example…

[php]

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[/php]

where action=profile is, that mean its on the same page as the index.php page, but you can have a dynamic page on there which is where action=profile come in. Thats the only way I know of it atm though… Btw, $_GET is almost the same as $_POST, except $_POST cant go in the browser url.

The way I look at these is $_POST could be referred to as… “Hey scooby Doo, did you put your Post(username) in the form and your password ‘Post(password)’?”

As for $_GET, i think of it as… “Hey dolly, we need to get the Get(page) for our site, make sure you get the homepage(Get(page=all))”… Yeah, kind of wierd but self explainatory.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make ?action=1, 2, 3, 4 etc?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:266827”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=350883.msg2702521#msg2702521 date=1236720174]

hmm now i think

[php]

<?php if( $_GET['c'] = 1 ) { echo "Testing"; } ?>

[/php]

Edit
It worked

No it didn’t
[/quote]
And why wouldn’t it?[/quote]
Assignments always evaluate to true.

item.title: How do i make ?action=1, 2, 3, 4 etc?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“imjohn10, post:2, topic:265777”]I think you mean a switch statement.

[code]<?php

switch ($_GET[‘action’])
{
case 1:
echo ‘action 1’;
break;

case 2:
	echo 'action 2';
break;

case 3:
	echo 'action 3';
break;

case 4:
	echo 'action 4';
break;

}

?>[/code][/quote]

Because nobody did it yet and its bugging me

<?php
$iliketowastetime = $_GET['action'];

echo "action" . $iliketowastetime
?>

Read full topic

I think you mean a switch statement.

[code]<?php

switch ($_GET[‘action’])
{
case 1:
echo ‘action 1’;
break;

case 2:
	echo 'action 2';
break;

case 3:
	echo 'action 3';
break;

case 4:
	echo 'action 4';
break;

}

?>[/code]
